verses.verse: The Song <S%H7892><s%> of Songs, <S%H7892><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is Solomon's.
"May he kiss <S%H5401><s%> me with the kisses <S%H5390><s%> of his mouth! <S%H6310><s%> For your love <S%H1730><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> wine. <S%H3196><s%>

"Your oils <S%H8081><s%> have a pleasing <S%H2896><s%> fragrance, <S%H7381><s%> Your name <S%H8034><s%> is [like] purified <S%H9553><s%> oil; <S%H8081><s%> Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> the maidens <S%H5959><s%> love <S%H157><s%> you.

"Draw <S%H4900><s%> me after <S%H310><s%> you [and] let us run <S%H7323><s%> [together!] The king <S%H4428><s%> has brought <S%H935><s%> me into his chambers. <S%H2315><s%>" "We will rejoice <S%H1523><s%> in you and be glad; <S%H8055><s%> We will extol <S%H2142><s%> your love <S%H1730><s%> more <S%H4480><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> wine. <S%H3196><s%> Rightly <S%H4339><s%> do they love <S%H157><s%> you."

"I am black <S%H7838><s%> but lovely, <S%H5000><s%> O daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> Like the tents <S%H168><s%> of Kedar, <S%H6938><s%> Like the curtains <S%H3407><s%> of Solomon. <S%H8010><s%>

"Do not stare <S%H7200><s%> at me because I am swarthy, <S%H7840><s%> For the sun <S%H8121><s%> has burned <S%H7805><s%> me. My mother's sons <S%H1121><s%> were angry <S%H2734><s%> with me; They made <S%H7760><s%> me caretaker <S%H5201><s%> of the vineyards, <S%H3754><s%> [But] I have not taken <S%H5201><s%> care <S%H5201><s%> of my own vineyard. <S%H3754><s%>

"Tell <S%H5046><s%> me, O you whom <S%H7945><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> loves, <S%H157><s%> Where <S%H351><s%> do you pasture <S%H7462><s%> [your flock,] Where <S%H351><s%> do you make [it] lie <S%H7257><s%> down <S%H7257><s%> at noon <S%H6672><s%>? For why <S%H4100><s%> should I be like one who veils <S%H5844><s%> herself Beside <S%H5921><s%> the flocks <S%H5739><s%> of your companions <S%H2270><s%>?"

"If <S%H518><s%> you yourself do not know, <S%H3045><s%> Most beautiful <S%H3303><s%> among women, <S%H802><s%> Go <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> on the trail <S%H6119><s%> of the flock, <S%H6629><s%> And pasture <S%H7462><s%> your young <S%H1429><s%> goats <S%H1429><s%> By the tents <S%H4908><s%> of the shepherds. <S%H7462><s%>
"To me, my darling, <S%H7474><s%> you are like <S%H1819><s%> My mare <S%H5484><s%> among the chariots <S%H7393><s%> of Pharaoh. <S%H6547><s%>
"Your cheeks <S%H3895><s%> are lovely <S%H4998><s%> with ornaments, <S%H8447><s%> Your neck <S%H6677><s%> with strings <S%H2737><s%> of beads. <S%H2737><s%>"
"We will make <S%H6213><s%> for you ornaments <S%H8447><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> With beads <S%H5351><s%> of silver. <S%H3701><s%>"
"While <S%H5704><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> was at his table, <S%H4524><s%> My perfume <S%H5373><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> forth its fragrance. <S%H7381><s%>
"My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is to me a pouch <S%H6872><s%> of myrrh <S%H4753><s%> Which lies <S%H3885><s%> all night <S%H3885><s%> between <S%H996><s%> my breasts. <S%H7699><s%>
"My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is to me a cluster <S%H811><s%> of henna <S%H9218><s%> blossoms In the vineyards <S%H3754><s%> of Engedi. <S%H5872><s%>"
"How <S%H2009><s%> beautiful <S%H3303><s%> you are, my darling, <S%H7474><s%> How <S%H2009><s%> beautiful <S%H3303><s%> you are! Your eyes <S%H5869><s%> are [like] doves. <S%H3123><s%>"
"How <S%H2009><s%> handsome <S%H3303><s%> you are, my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> [And] so <S%H637><s%> pleasant! <S%H5273><s%> Indeed, <S%H637><s%> our couch <S%H6210><s%> is luxuriant! <S%H7488><s%>
"The beams <S%H6982><s%> of our houses <S%H1004><s%> are cedars, <S%H730><s%> Our rafters, <S%H7351><s%> cypresses. <S%H1266><s%>
